title: Farming with nature
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Land use - Remote areas
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Environment - Social aspects
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Natural resources - Environmental aspects
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Natural history
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Grassland ecology
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Environment - Social aspects
description: Tells the story of 70 year-old Missouri farmer Gene Poirot and his successful struggle to restore the fertility of a wornout prairie farm. Describes the ecological farming techniques developed by Poirot in the course of fifty years of observation of a natural grasslands ecosystem, drawing on methods from traditional and modern sources.
